results.title: TypeScript: JavaScript With Syntax For Types.
results.snippet: TypeScript is a strongly typed programming language that builds on JavaScript, giving you better tooling at any scale. Learn how to use TypeScript to describe your data, catch errors early, and convert to JavaScript.

results.title: TypeScript Introduction - W3Schools
results.snippet: TypeScript is JavaScript with added syntax for types. Learn what TypeScript is, why and how to use it, and how to get certified by w3schools.com.

results.title: TypeScript - Wikipedia
results.snippet: TypeScript was released to the public in October 2012, with version 0.8, after two years of internal development at Microsoft. [13] [14] Soon after the initial public release, Miguel de Icaza praised the language, but criticized the lack of mature integrated development environment (IDE) support apart from Microsoft Visual Studio, which was unavailable then on Linux and macOS.

results.title: Introduction to TypeScript - GeeksforGeeks
results.snippet: TypeScript Code cannot be interpreted by the Browser directly so there is a need to compile the TypeScript code into plain JavaScript Code, for this purpose we need the TypeScript Compiler (tsc). TypeScript Compiler (tsc) Written in TypeScript itself. Compiles .ts files to .js files. Installed as an NPM package (NodeJS). Supports ES6 syntax.

results.title: The starting point for learning TypeScript
results.snippet: TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript that adds optional static typing and other features. This web page provides comprehensive guides, tutorials, reference materials, and learning resources for TypeScript beginners and experts.
